aShell You ADB at your fingertips Abort command first Access denied You might need to accept a prompt on the other device if you are trying to connect to it for the first time from this device ADB device connected. ADB device not connected. Waiting for ADB device ADB shell ADB Through OTG Use an OTG cable and USB debugging to execute ADB commands on another Android device. You need to turn on USB Debugging in the developer settings of the target device. ADB via Wireless Debugging Connect devices (Android 11+) over Wi-Fi using wireless debugging and execute ADB commands remotely. Add bookmark Additional settings About Accept You are using the latest version Amoled dark theme Pure black theme for devices with OLED panel App has crashed aShell You is here for all your ADB needs App is updated, want to see changelogs? aShell You is still working. Please wait for it to finish or manually stop (by clicking the stop button) to run a new command Are you sure you want to continue? Basic shell This feature is currently in its experimental phase. If you encounter any issues please let us know. Behavior Bookmarks '%s' is bookmarked %d commands are bookmarked Maximum bookmark limit reached! Delete some bookmarks to add new ones '%s' has been removed from bookmarks %d commands are removed from bookmarks %d commands are pinned %d commands are unpinned Cancel Changelogs Check your internet connection Check updates Choose Are you sure you want to clear everything on this screen? Clear everything Clear screen Clipboard doesn't contain text Close Commands Input ADB Command Input command Confirm Selected %d items will be added to bookmarks Selected %d items will be removed from bookmarks Confirm delete Warning ! This action is irreversible
Are you sure you want to delete all bookmarks? Confirm exit All unpinned commands will be pinned
Do you wish to continue? \[%s\] will be pinned
Do you wish to continue? Do you want to unpin the selected commands? \[%s\] will be unpinned
Do you wish to continue? Connect Connected Connect a new device Connected device Connected devices connecting… confirm authorization on target device Connection failed Connect this device Connect other device Copy Copied to clipboard Crash report Current Dark theme Delete all Default folder Denied Default language Choose the default language for the app Developer options Developer options not available! Device not connected Disclaimer This app allows you to execute ADB (Android Debug Bridge) commands directly on your device without needing a PC. Please read the following carefully before using the app: While root access is not mandatory, certain commands may require elevated permissions. Misuse of ADB commands can lead to data loss, app crashes, or unexpected system behavior. We Are Not Liable Intended for Advanced Users This app is designed for users who have a basic understanding of ADB commands. If you are unsure about a command’s effect, research it before executing it. Permissions and Security This app may require special permissions to function properly. It does not collect or share personal data, but users should be aware of the implications of granting ADB-related permissions. By using this app, you acknowledge and agree to these terms. If you do not accept these conditions, please refrain from using the app. Disconnected Discord Join the discord community Dismiss Disabled Don't show again Download Dynamic colors Automatically set the app theme according to the device wallpaper E-mail Enable wifi Enter Pairing Code Enter six digit pairing code Error Example Examples Failed File not found Failed to generate and save key pair You're about to download updates directly from GitHub. Unlike updates from app stores, these are not reviewed for security. Do you want to continue? Github issue Granted Grant permission If the permission dialog doesn't appear, please grant root permission manually via the superuser application Flashing Folder picker Go back High contrast dark theme History Instructions IP address Latest Least used Local ADB Execute ADB commands directly on your device using Shizuku or root. Manage apps, control system settings, and perform advanced debugging—all without needing a PC. Look & Feel Dynamic colors, Dark theme, Language E-mail Menu Mode Most used Must fill None
No application found to perform the task No bookmarks found No changelog No command No command found that matches your query No devices has been connected yet! Connect a device to proceed No command history Not available Nothing to clear Nothing to search To complete the pairing process you will need to interact with a notification from aShell You. Please allow notification access to aShell You. Notification settings If you cannot enter the Pairing Code from the notification, then you might need to change the Notification Shade to Android. Go to Notification Settings ~ Notification Style to change the Notification Style. Otherwise you might not be able to enter the pairing code from the notification. Off OK OK (10s) On Only last command output Open Open ADB shell Open Shizuku OTG Connect the device properly through OTG and try again Paste Pair Paired Pairing You will receive a notification from aShell You to help you with pairing Pairing port Pairing code Granting these permissions is optional! Pick script Pin '%s' has been pinned Port Press back again to exit aShell You is still working. Do you want to stop the current process? Progress Quit Do you want to quit aShell You? Remember last working mode Request Permission Report Resume Root Root access Root access is currently denied for aShell You Root provider Root is not accessible Device might not be rooted or root presence might be hidden from aShell You Save Root commands are not available Search Search commands here Search output here Selected Select all You are about to execute ADB commands involving critical system packages. Modifying, disabling, or uninstalling these packages may cause serious issues, including: ⚠️ System crashes or boot loops ⚠️ Loss of essential features (e.g., UI, network, security) ⚠️ Permanent damage requiring a factory reset or firmware reinstallation If you are unsure about the impact, DO NOT PROCEED unless you have a full backup and know how to recover your device. Search in commands summary? Settings setAdbInterface(device, intf) fail Auto run shared commands If enabled then sharing any text to aShell You automatically runs the shell with the shared text as input Shell script executor Run bash/shell scripts directly in the app with live output The output of last command is not saved The output of last command is exported to '%s' folder The shell output is exported to '%s' folder Shell is working Shizuku About Shizuku Shizuku access Access to Shizuku service is denied for aShell You Shizuku is unavailable Shizuku is not installed or properly configured on your device Sort A → Z Z → A Newest Oldest Start Submit Success Like what I do?
Consider buying me a coffee ! This mode doesn't support root related commands. Please switch to root mode Switch mode System Turn off Mobile Data if the Wifi connection has NO INTERNET Unpin '%s' has been unpinned All info cards will be visible now Update Update available ! A newer version of aShell You is available !
Click on Download button to get the new version from the repository Important You need to turn on USB Debugging in the developer settings of the target device Use Haptics and vibration Interactive haptics for touch feedback Waiting for device Warning ⚠ WARNING: Proceed with Caution! ⚠ Wireless Debugging Go to Developer options > Wireless Debugging. Tap on Pair device with Pairing Code. Come back to the app and click on the "Start" button in the home screen. Please note that the left part of the Wireless Debugging option is clickable. Tapping on it will open the Wireless Debugging Pairing menu. What's new ! Whole output Wifi ADB Select a target device to continue To use the Wireless Debugging feature, your device must be connected to a Wi-Fi network. If your Wi-Fi connection has no Internet access then turn off mobile data for a solid Wi-Fi connection. Yes Choose local adb working mode Choose a preffered mode for executing shell commands on your device Save output preference Choose what portion of the shell output should be saved Smooth scrolling Enables smooth scrolling in the shell output when top or bottom arrow is clicked Ask before clearing shell output If enabled a confirmation popup will show after you click the Clear screen button Auto update check Automatically checks for available newer versions when the app launches Override maximum bookmarks limit Might cause lag if a large number of bookmarks are added! Low end devices should keep this option turned off Disable soft keyboard Useful when you want to use an external keyboard Collection of some command templates Unhide info cards All information cards will be visible again History of all the changes made to the app Version & Credits Lead developer Just a guy who loves apps and design Contributors Developer of Shizuku
Shizuku allows the app to run ADB commands without rooting your device Developer of aShell
Without him aShell You wouldn't exist Developer of ADB⚡OTG
aShell You got the basic functionality of OTG shell from ADB⚡OTG The best guy in the world has been an incredible help. Without him, aShell wouldn't be here. Thanks a ton for your support, buddy! Android & Backend developer
He is a highly skilled professional who has made significant contributions to the app's UI and UX design Developer of Iconify
He is a nice guy who has helped me solve issues regarding the app A freelancer translator who did the Portuguese translations The guy who did the Chinese translations Turkese translations are done by him App Version Report an issue Report any issue you have faced while using the app Feature request If you have any ideas or suggestions in your mind , let us know Github Visit the github repository of aShell You Telegram Telegram channel Join the telegram channel for discussion License Learn about the license this app is using Continue Back Root Use root access to run commands. Rooted commands can be executed. Shizuku Use shizuku to run commands. Commands that require root won't execute. No higher privelege is granted. App will only execute basic commands. You can change the working mode later in settings Examples layout style Choose the preferred layout style to view command examples Configure save directory Choose a directory to save the shell output Grid List Pairing failed Use at Your Own Risk Running ADB commands can modify system settings, manage files, and perform operations that may affect your device’s stability. You are solely responsible for any changes made using this app. Root is not Mandatory, but Caution Needed The developer(s) of this app are not responsible for any damage, data loss, or unintended consequences resulting from the use of this app. Proceed with caution and ensure you understand the commands you execute. Enter the six digit Pairing Code into the notification sent by aShell You. // Changelogs //Created by DP-Hridayan Absolutely necessary to follow this string name format 

• Now command search can search the commands that contains the word you typed compared to previous versions where it only searched commands that starts with the typed word.

• Option to open Shizuku app directly when Shizuku is installed but not running.

• Fixed the broken in app crash reporter. 

• Fixed the issue which caused per app translations to be broken for aShell You 

• Adapted Github Actions for release builds.

• What this means for you?
• All subsequent builds including this will be more secure! 

• Maintenance update 

• Added WIRELESS DEBUGGING mode for running ADB commands on both own or other device

• Redesigned homepage for minimal navigation and less cluttery input field screen

• Added Warning feedback when executing commands involving critical system packages

• Added in-app updater. Now you can directly download the latest package without visiting Github repository

• Fixed a lot of bugs 

• Maintenance update 

• UI improvements

• Fixed some bugs 

• Small UI improvements 

• Huge UI and UX improvements across all sections of the app

• Added ROOT and BASIC shell in addition to Shizuku shell for running commands

• Added option to save output in custom directory

• Fixed a lot of bugs and issues

• Optimised app's code for better performance and stability 

• Added vibration for haptic feedback

• Added option to change app language from within the app (for devices running Android 13 and above only and excluding unsupported devices)

• Fixed some crashes and improved crash reporting

• Minor UI improvements 

• Now app catches any crashes and provides the option to report them via email 

• Added option to open saved output directly

• Added option to save whole output or the last command output only

• Fixed crashes 

• Fixed an issue with Sharing text to aShell You where the text did not appear when app was starting fresh

• Fixed minor UI issues 

• Stable release of OTG mode

• Added features like save, share, quick scroll buttons to the OTG mode

• Added info cards for quick information

• Added in app update checker along with the option to auto check for updates

• Minor UI improvements 

• Fixed some issues in OTG adb support

• Updated translations 

• Updated dependencies

• Added more command examples 

• Fixed AMOLED theme not working on devices running Android 11 or below 

• Now you can Pin commands for quick access

 • Bug fixes and lot of code optimisations 

• Now you can directly use commands from the Commands section instead of the need to copy them every time

 • Added option to delete all bookmarks

• In search : You can now search in commands summary by clicking a prompt chip

• Added sorting options in Commands templates

• Added option to directly bookmark selected items in Commands section

• Chip Indicator shows connected device(currently only in local ADB mode)

• Fixed bugs causing crashes in devices running Android 11 or below

• Added Turkish translation

• Minor UI improvements

• Lot of other bug fixes 

• Added total bookmarks count

• Fixed some bugs 

• Added Search in commands section

• Added option to set default working mode

• Improved animations

• Reworked bookmarks section and added sorting options

• Increased bookmarks limit to 25

• Removed ADB shell launcher shortcut and added Commands launcher shortcut

• Fixed padding issues in button navigation

• Fixed some buttons shape 

• App uses a more refreshed color palette for material you themeing

• Fixed minor bugs 

• Fixed some crashes that were introduced in v3.8.0 

• Added black (amoled) theme

• Added undo button to undo paste

• Added option to disable soft keyboard

• Fixed buttons stretched in some screen sizes

• Fixed bookmarks button not appearing after opening the app

• Renamed Examples section to Commands

• Fixed copy command option not appearing for every command template

• App now uses system font everywhere

• Improved UI handling

• Updated translations


• Now you can share texts from anywhere on your device to aShell You and run commands directly.

• Now you can share shell output directly without needing to save it !

• A lot of optimisations and UI handling.

• Added Chinese translations.

• Updated translations.


• Added option to clear the command input field after an error

• Fixed a bug which caused the app to crash upon pasting from clipboard under certain conditions

• Code optimisations 

• Fixed some issues with bottom navigation.


• Revamped About section of the app.

• Added launcher shortcuts.

• Fixed navigation menu not showing in button navigation.

• Improved bottom navigation menu visibility on scrolling.

• Added per app language support for aShell You (translations aren't completed yet).

• A lot of code optimisations.


• Added a Paste button so that you can copy and paste commands quickly.

• Added Error indicators in the text input field.

• Improved Navigation Bar visibility logic.

• Fixed an issue where switches misbehaves under certain situations.

• Fixed add bookmark icon visibility in various contrast levels.

• A lot of code optimisation. App now opens a lot faster than before.

• App will stay in background and won't restart every time you close the app by just pressing the back button or gesture.


• Added bookmarks , history and command suggestions to OTG

• Added maximum bookmarks limit.

• Added option to override maximum bookmarks limit.

• A lot of bug fixes.

• Improved some UI handling.

• A lot of code optimisation.


• A lot of UI related improvements.

• Added chips that indicate current ADB working mode.

• A lot of code optimisation.


• Improvements to ADB OTG after initial release.

• Some UI and logic adjustments to accomodate the new otg feature.


• Added ADB THROUGH OTG support.

 *** You will be able to run ADB commands on other devices using aShellYou by connecting the other device using an OTG cable ***


• Removed unnecessary code and resources.

• Minor UI changes.


• Removed unnecessary code and resources.

• Minor UI changes.


• Changed app name to aShell You.

• Added predictive back animations for supporting devices.

• Added confirmation dialog popup before clearing screen.

• Fixed StatusBar elements not properly visible in Light mode.

• App is much more smooth now.
 ~ Reduced app size and optimised code.

• Added themed icon for launchers that support themed icons.

• Minor UI changes.


• Revamped Settings panel.

• Added Double Tap to instant scroll to top and bottom positions in shell output view.

• Minor UI fixes.


• Added Settings panel.

• Added option to disable smooth scroll in shell output.

• Fixed major bugs:

 ~ Crash while changing device theme.

 ~ Crash while trying to save large shell output . eg : output of 'pm' command.


• Replaced some deprecated api.

• Minor UI changes.


• Added Scroll To Top and Scroll To Bottom buttons.

• Added Click keyboard Enter key to Send command.

• Added some commands.

• Updated dependencies to include latest material you library.

• Minor UI changes.


• Added some more command examples.

• Minor UI changes.

• Changed package name to avoid version confusion with original app.


• Added changelogs into the app.

• Added highlighted shell output.

• Minor UI changes.


• Added dynamic material theming.

• Revamped whole UI to give a fresh look.
